is a town on the island of

located in Massachusetts, USA. Tisbury includes the village of Vineyard Haven which is the island's year-round ferry port. One can find numerous activities, fine dining, and great places to stay on the island. Tisbury is located on the north side of the island, closest to Woods Hole, Cape Cod.

There are many ferry services that will get you to the island of Martha's Vineyard.  The biggest one is the MV and Nantucket Steamship Authority which leaves from Woods Hole in Cape Cod 1-508-693-9130 or
One can also use Hyline Cruises which departs from Hyannis in the cape.

value: . Offers a low, one way rate to Martha's Vineyard between
is another ferry service offered in Cape Cod Falmouth.
is another ferry that leaves from the Fishing Pier in Falmouth.

One could even use Cape Air to get there by plane.  It has daily flights departing from Hyannis and Boston.
Tisbury is a part of Martha's Vineyard Transit Authority providing buses to other towns on the island during the tourist months.
Tisbury is a great place to walk or bike around and enjoy shopping and eating.
There are taxi services located on the island.

value: , +1 508-693-0309/+1-888-244-2262. Stoney Hill Road: free tours of the winery are offered from May-Oct: 11AM-5PM M-Sa; 1PM-5PM Su. Wines can be sampled in the tasting rooms. Wines and specialty foods are offered for sale year around, including holiday wine and food baskets.

, +1 508-693-6026. Produces and sells a unique variety of fine quality hand-blown glass while featuring internationally removed artists in the gallery. The public is invited to watch a master craftsmen create beautiful objects in glass.
. 9AM-5PM daily. Nature trails that lead up from shore through the forest and grassland. The admission fee for adults is $3; children get in free. Parking costs $9 per car.
directions=the beach is just at the foot of Owen Park off Upper Main St

content=The water and waves there are calm and the beach is mostly sand with pebbles closer to tide. Here you can watch the yachts, sailboats, and historic ships travel in and out of the Harbor, while your kids play on the small provided playground. On alternating Sundays, the Gazebo in Owen Park hosts the Vineyard Haven concerts for local bands to show off their talent. There are also public bathrooms here.

. Constructed in the late 1800s. The light is located in historic Tisbury. Unfortunately, the grounds are privately owned and are not open to the public. However, the tower and light may be seen from the road.

Tisbury is a great island for watersports and outdoor activities. There are numerous indoor activities as well.

value: content=Nine holes, semi-private -- non-members can make tee times two days in advance.

A teaching studio for hand paper making, surface design, and book arts where you can explore paper making possibilities. Summer Sessions Only. Call for pricing.

value: , P.O. Box 1451 West Tisbury, MA-508-642-0363.  Rent sailboats, or visit the Black Dog Tavern and charter a sunset cocktail cruise.
content=At Five Corners. A great way to get around to the shops and beaches is by bike.
price=$8 for children and $9 for adults (web site coupons offer $1 off)
content=An activity for all ages. Kids especially enjoy the water-themed course consisting of frog ponds and waterfalls as well as their 24 foot climbing wall.

content=Four days filled with the best feature and short films from top-notch festivals such as Sundance, Berlin and Cannes (with a few undiscovered gems thrown in!), great evening events, provocative forums and live world music - all within the ‘Walking Festival District’. And don’t forget – Martha’s Vineyard has some of the most beautiful beaches in America.

The recurring theme of the annual Martha's Vineyard International Film Festival is "Other Places"; the festival's purpose is to encourage attendees to think broadly (about how huge the world of film is) and deeply (about the universal concerns and desires that unite all people). About 90% of all film selections are non-US productions, helping to fulfill the festival mission of promoting cross-cultural understanding through film.

The International Film Festival is produced by the Martha's Vineyard Film Society, a 501 c3 non-profit corporation. Our festival is completely run by volunteers and greatly appreciates your support.

Fish from the Vineyard Haven Jetty or Eastville Beach.

value: content=Water Street. The simplistic black dog located on Black Dog merchandise has become iconic and is very popular. A merchandise store is attached to the Black Dog Tavern restaurant.
hours=open year round Monday through Saturday from 10-5

content=A good pit stop if you are interested in finding toys and trinkets to remind you of your day on the island.  In this shop you will find outdoor toys, beach toys, educational toys, arts and craft supplies.
, Union Street and Main Street, +1 508 693-7344. A candy store with homemade fudge.

content=Take into consideration that you have to get here early (Around 8 AM, opens at 7) to avoid a long wait because it is small and crowded in season. Their pecan pancakes with real rum raisins, french toast (stuffed with almost anything you want), and the sweet potato crepes (all priced at $8-$10) are just a few of the locals' favorites, but the menu has a lot of options. Credit cards are accepted.
content=Offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner and not only serve pizza and subs but have a clam bar and outdoor seating.

content=Beach Street Ext. The famous one of t-shirt fame. Nobody wears it on the island. Main menu items are fresh fish and vegetables, each from local sources. You can bring your own wine or beer. Mon-Frim 7am-8pm; Sat-Sun 7am-9pm.
content=Vineyard Haven. An elegant dining room that offers a relaxing and enjoyable way to spend an evening. 6PM-9PM daily in summer; hours vary during the spring and fall; open weekends in winter.
content=Vineyard Haven. Year-round. French cuisine served daily from 5:30PM-10PM.
content= Trendy cafe serves good cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere. An island favorite.
, Main Street, Vineyard Haven, +1 508 693-3416. Seafood, ribs, etc.
content=Vineyard Haven. Brazilian, casual. Great location at the marina.
directions=next to Riley's Reads, just off Main St., Cromwell Lane is the small road that leads down to Stop and Shop
content=They serve healthy, to-go treats. They have 33+ toppings (including fresh fruit) for their frozen yogurts and smoothies providing a variety to please customers of all ages.

content=They serve the Vineyard’s American Cuisine year round either indoors, outdoors, or even for take-out, whatever you prefer. Here you can taste their seasonal dishes or just go simple with a burger and a beer. ( 2 for 1 burgers on Tuesdays!)

. Although alcohol cannot be bought here, most restaurants allow  visitors to bring their own.

value: content= Vineyard Haven. Open late April-early October.
content=Vineyard Haven. On the harbor with private beach. Within walking distance to ferry terminals, restaurants and shops.
content=Beach Road, Vineyard Haven. 39 units. Near ferry, shops, beach, etc.

content=Vineyard Haven. Air Conditioned rooms and suites. Amenities includes free breakfast, access to Health Club and pool, fireplaces, balconies, DSL and Wifi, Cable TV, refrigerators, and convenience to local attractions.
content= 180 sites. 1.5 mi. (2.4 km) from the ferry terminal (with shuttle service).
